Temporary Defines
[Optional Defines]

Collaboration diagram for Temporary Defines:

The temporary defines should only be introduced for compatibility reasons. More...

Defines

#define APOXI_ADC_CCP_CODE
 Temporary test code for CCP access
#define APOXI_ADC_SIMTK_PROACTIVE_CODE
 Temporary code for Simtk simulation triggering
#define APOXI_CINGULAR_INPUT_TEST
 shall not be set manually
#define APOXI_HEAP_TEST
 shall not be set manually

Detailed Description

The temporary defines should only be introduced for compatibility reasons.

Temporary defines are especially of use to provide compatibility to the lower interface of APOXI, like protocol stack, driver, etc. The responsible developer must care to remove temporary defines he has created when there is no need any more.

These defines are important to system integration work, which must be aware of the compatibility of the various project module layers. For example if more protocol stack versions have different interfaces due to misaligned release dates, a temporary define has to be created to be able to build with both protocol stack versions.

Temporary defines have to be enabled also via the project configuration file. The project integrator has to be aware of enabling the correct defines.

In CBE again this is done in the file project.config.default, located in the ${GLOBALPATH}/system-build/make directory, using the environment variable SYSTEM_DEFS.


Naming convention for new created temporary defines:

APOXI_TEMP_<functionality>, where

  • <functionality> describes the functionality, which is activated.
